title: What kind of gun is this?
content:
Anyone know what kind of gun is this in this image. I need to recreate down section of the gun.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109100500im_/http:/typophile.com/files/87400-GUN_6155.jpg)
author: artslons

comments.content: Maybe you should ask a weapon forum or your local ministry of defence?
Yes, we only know about b•llets.
OOPS!!!! sorry but acutully i need to vectorized this gun so was geting information from here.
Well, it's a coast defense gun. If you want make and model, that will take more research. Where did you find the image?

Probably a German 88 used for coastal defense. The same gunmodel was also deployed as AA and in tanks.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

There is nothing in the photo to denote scale, but I had something much bigger in mind than what would fit in a tank. An 88 would be a bit over 3 inches, right? I was envisioning something closer to 6 inches, from the photo.

Don \<--- not an expert, having never fired anything bigger than a pellet gun
Ok ok i got cleared this job. My client asked me to forget about the bottom area. He only give me the image, Thanks to all for your help

88 is the bore, not the outside measure of the barrel. But I am not a gun expert, so…  
: )

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109100500im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CannonSumpter_5950.jpg)

Fort Sumpter 19th Century large bore Coastal defense gun. Way bigger than 6".

ChrisL

\> 88 is the bore, not the outside measure of the barrel

That was the same assumption I was using.

\> But I am not a gun expert, so...

Isn't it odd that in a group this large there hasn't been one come forward? Those people are usually everywhere.

:)

I am happy that Typophiles are not gun nuts.  
: )

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
Does that mean that we all can be mad in only one way?
